summary: This bill, the Unfunded Mandates Accountability and Transparency Act of 2025, amends the Unfunded Mandates Reform Act of 1995. It mandates regulatory impact analyses for certain major rules, including assessments of costs, benefits, and alternatives. It enhances stakeholder consultation, particularly with the private sector. The bill grants new authorities and responsibilities to the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs (OIRA), and it provides for judicial review. It aims to improve transparency and accountability in the rulemaking process and extends coverage to independent regulatory agencies while exempting monetary policy. The effective date is 120 days after enactment.
